      • scramDigest

        static byte[] scramDigest​(java.lang.String algorithm,
                          byte[] password,
                          byte[] salt,
                          int iterationCount)
                   throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                          java.security.InvalidKeyException

        This method implements the SCRAM Hi function as specified by RFC 5802. The function is defined as follows: 

             Hi(str, salt, i)
         U1 <- HMAC(str, salt + INT(1))
         U2 <- HMAC(str, U1)
         ...
         Ui-1 <- HMAC(str, Ui-2)
         Ui <- HMAC(str, Ui-1)
         Hi <- U1 XOR U2 XOR ... XOR Ui
         return Hi
        where i is the iteration count, + is the string concatenation operator, and INT(g) is a 4-octet encoding of the integer g, most significant octet first.

        Parameters:
        algorithm - the algorithm that should be used to hash the password.
        password - the password to be hashed.
        salt - the salt used to hash the password.
        iterationCount - the iteration count used to hash the password.
        Returns:
        a byte[] containing the hashed password.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException

      • addIterations

        private static javax.crypto.Mac getMacInstance​(java.lang.String algorithm,
                                               byte[] password)
                                        throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                               java.security.InvalidKeyException

        Builds a Mac instance using the specified algorithm and password.

        Parameters:

        password - the password to be hashed.
        Returns:
        the constructed Mac instance.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
